meanings.definition: Drive back (an attack or attacking enemy) by force.
meanings.sent1: The brave soldiers were able to repulse the enemy's fierce attack.
meanings.sent2: The castle's strong defenses helped repulse the invaders.
meanings.sent3: The idea of eating bugs might repulse some people, but they are a good source of protein.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to succeed was like a shield that repulsed any doubts or fears.
meanings.sent5: The image of the superhero repulsing the alien invasion stayed in his mind.

meanings.definition: Cause (someone) to feel intense distaste and aversion.
meanings.sent1: The foul smell of the garbage bin repulsed the passersby.
meanings.sent2: The gruesome scene in the movie repulsed many viewers.
meanings.sent3: The idea of eating a sandwich filled with worms might repulse some, but it's just a Halloween prank.
meanings.sent4: The politician's dishonesty repulsed the voters, leading to his defeat.
meanings.sent5: The slimy texture of the food repulsed her more than anything else.
